column2: Karl Marx has published The Communist Manifesto, which has led to workers in $COUNTRY$ to found a party dedicated to advancing the agenda laid out therein. They call themselves socialists and believe in a land ruled by the workers, where the workers control the means of production. Equality, justice, solidarity and democracy are other vital points in the socialists ideology.

column4: Karl Marx hat das Kommunistische Manifest herausgegeben, das die Arbeiter in $COUNTRY$ zur Grdung einer Partei veranlasst hat, welche die Forderungen dieses Traktats zum Ziel hat. Sie nennen sich Sozialisten und glauben an ein Land, das von Arbeitern gefrt wird und in dem Arbeiter die Produktionsmittel bestimmen. Gleichheit, Gerechtigkeit, Solidarit酹 und Demokratie sind weitere wichtige Punkte der sozialistischen Ideologie.
column6: Karl Marx ha publicado 'El Manifiesto Comunista', lo que ha llevado a los obreros de $COUNTRY$ a fundar un partido dedicado al progreso de los ideales y agenda perfilados en el mismo. Se denominan socialistas y creen en una tierra gobernada por los trabajadores, en la cual, ellos controlan los medios de producci鏮. Igualdad, justicia, solidaridad y democracia son algunos de los puntos vitales de la ideolog燰 socialista.

column2: The Hague Congress has proven there is no hope for a united socialist movement. Marx is right, the workers taking over the state is what is needed. The working class needs a political party, it  is indispensable in order to ensure the triumph of the social revolution and its ultimate end, the abolition of classes.

A new movement has been growing that has called for radical reform. This movement is not content with the current liberal movement. The people want freedom of the press, redestribution of property, better working and social conditions and self-determination for nationalities.These "Radicals" threaten the current status quo of Europe and ultimatly the world and could drastically shift the balance of power in years to come.

Strength through Unity! The government has grown weak, we need a party who can unite us, who can give us a strong national identity and who will not be fooled by capitalism's sweet but poisonous voice.' The Third Way, or fascists as they might be called, are looking to get a seat in the Upper House.

La troisi鋗e voie, ou fascistes comme ils pourraient 皻re appel廥, cherche ?obtenir un si銶e ?la Chambre haute.

Die Regierung ist schwach geworden, wir brauchen eine Partei, die uns einigen kann, die uns eine starke nationale Identit酹 geben kann, und die nicht durch die se, aber giftige Stimme des Kapitalismus verfrt wird.' Der Dritte Weg, auch Faschisten genannt, versuchen, einen Sitz im Oberhaus zu erlangen.

column2: The action of expelling Anarchists from the First Internationale proves that these "Marxists" have no real interest in actually freeing workers from the oppression of the state. The State should not simply be taken over, it should be abolished completely. We must organize the workers in unions and federations to achieve this goal, not bourgeoisies style political parties. Bourgeoisie isn't for the good of the workers but the good of the capitalist class hence we must desroy it as well.
Power breeds parasites. Long live Anarchy!
